relationships.description: Acting as financial advisor for credit card extension
Amazon acquiring Middle Eastern eCommerce platform

analysis.purpose: Provide Q1 2017 earnings preview and analysis for internet sector companies
analysis.significance: Comprehensive sector analysis from major financial institution during key earnings period

concerns: CFPB potential regulation of Zillow's mortgage referral system

notable_quotes: For large-caps, Street 2017 EPS estimates are down 8% YTD while the average stock price is up 9% YTD; suggesting macro and 2H optimism is driving stocks
Amazon announced that it has an agreement to acquire Souq.com, the leading eCommerce platform in the Middle East
The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) has indicated that it views Zillow's mortgage referral system as potentially violating parts of the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act
red_flags: High volatility in internet stocks despite earnings estimate declines
Regulatory concerns around Zillow's mortgage business

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion in this financial research document

illegal_activity.description: Document is a financial research report containing market analysis and earnings previews - no illegal activity discussed or evidenced

details: References to Financial Times interview with Expedia CEO
Media coverage of various company developments

public_knowledge.context: Public financial research report from major investment bank covering well-known public companies

analysis.summary: BofA Merrill Lynch's Q1 2017 internet sector preview analyzes earnings expectations for 30 covered stocks, noting that while EPS estimates are down YTD, stock prices are up, suggesting macro optimism is driving performance. The report covers key themes including advertising revenue initiatives, competitive pressures, and regulatory concerns, with detailed company-specific analysis and estimates.
